description.narrative: • Short general project overviewLand Subsidence (LS) in the Mekong Delta and coastal metropolitan cities like Ho Chi Minh City, Can Tho and adjacent delta lands significantly exceeds the rate of sea level rise (SLR). Therefore, Land Subsidence is a major factor causing flooding, additional damage due to deterioration of embankments, as well as loss of valuable land due to coastal erosion. Additionally, LS causes degradation of (water-related) infrastructure like large bridges, highways, river embankments, sluices and port facilities) and further economic losses due to increased costs of maintenance. The causes of LS are partly natural and predictable in origin, but the observed higher rates are caused by human activities – by high-density urban construction or by excessive groundwater extraction.The methods that are currently used for measuring LS in Vietnam are generally very localized/ad-hoc (non-consistent), not always reliable and time consuming. This is hampering the awareness of the problem, the design of effective solutions and the implementation of mitigating measures. InSAR is a technology in which satellite images are analysed to produce millimetre-precise measurements of height changes. It offers an accurate, cost-effective and uniform method to determine LS rates and to detect and monitor vulnerable locations with high spatial and temporal resolution. However, due to the complexity of the technique, InSAR has so far only been applied on an ad-hoc basis by (mostly non-Vietnamese) Earth Observation researchers using time-consuming and complex project software.Sensar is breaking this status quo by developing the first InSAR Platform-as-a-Service (PaaS) with end-to-end automation. A Platform-as-a-Service can be seen as multiple software programs, working together on multiple (cloud) servers to deliver certain tangible results to the user without the user having to worry about technical details. This approach allows local consultancy firms to request, generate, analyse and deliver InSAR-derived datasets without owning or operating highly complex software. The solution makes advanced Dutch cloud-based technology available to be used (at a fee) by local consultants to generate business.The goal of this project is to test the commercial and legal feasibility of the Sensar platform in the context of SE Asia, and more specifically in Vietnam, and to investigate whether this can enable local parties to start using powerful InSAR data operationally. This would open a whole new market for Sensar with InSAR-as-a-Service, that before could not be served with traditional InSAR analysis.
